website_summaries.verdict: A set of four pieces to create the ultimate relaxing position in bed.
pros: Includes lumbar support, head rest, and knee rest
Pieces are encased in memory foam for added comfort
Microsuede sides have a soft touch
Covers can be removed and laundered
cons: It's pricey, and some people find it too firm

customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help me with my recovery after a double mastectomy. After my surgery I hot home and tried it. It does not work the pillows slide and do not stay in place. I tried to get a refund and the seller will not do it because it is part the 30 days. That's terrable customer service. I understand it is over the 30 days but it has been like 45 days not like its months.

customer_reviews.title: I love the Avana Kind Bed Support System
customer_reviews.text: Due to chronic pain I have not been able to sleep in bed for 1 1/2 years. I kept trying to figure out a way to sleep comfortably in bed. Someone in my support group recommended Avana Kind Bed to me. I decided to give it a try. I can now sleep comfortably in bed and I don't have to sleep in my recliner in the living room. The Avana Kind Bed Support System is so comfortable and it stays cool so I don't have any issues with becoming to warm while I sleep. I am so glad I purchased this! Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Rex O. Britton Jr.

customer_reviews.title: ... need to sleep sitting up this was a really good choice way more comfortable than my recliner
customer_reviews.text: Had a double mastectomy and need to sleep sitting up this was a really good choice way more comfortable than my recliner.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is amazing!!!
customer_reviews.text: I unrolled it ( slightly skeptical ) and watched it fluff right up!! And guess what? No smell at all. I used it for the first time to lay and bed and read within 4 hrs of it arriving. Oh! My! Goodness!!!! I can honestly say this is the best purchase I have ever made! I am not kidding. I typically read in bed for about two hours before going to sleep and usually wake up with neck aches and headaches. This morning I woke up refreshed with no pain!!! I am 5'2" and weigh 135 lbs and it is sooooo comfortable!!!
customer_reviews.author: Gerald

customer_reviews.title: Bought for after shoulder surgery
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for after shoulder surgery (labrum) as a way to sleep upright without sleeping in a recliner. I'm only 2 days out from my surgery, but it has been wonderful. I've used it as shown in the picture, but have also used just one or two of the pillows along with my regular pillows. The ability to move things around has been REALLY useful. Update: Two weeks out from surgery and I'm still using the pillows. I often use a mix of the pillow system and my regular pillows. As someone who cannot sleep on their back or upright, these pillows have really helped.
customer_reviews.author: Casey H

customer_reviews.title: Did the trick!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in lieu of a very expensive bed mechanism that raises the head of one's mattress. It works perfectly. Before, I used a number of pillows to bolster myself up ... and I always seemed to experience pain when I got up from the bed (I had back surgery a couple of years back). With the Avana system, I'm getting the lower back support I need when sitting up in my bed ... and when I have occasion to to rise, there is no pain. This is wonderful! I highly recommend this pillow system back pain sufferers.
customer_reviews.author: R. L. Diaz-Rios

customer_reviews.title: Great pillows!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the pillow system for use after back surgery. I love it! I took one star off for the leg pillow because it was not nearly as firm as the other sections. I use it the most and it isn't quite firm enough for my needs; I use it with a pillow on top of it.
customer_reviews.author: alexandra k smith

customer_reviews.title: excellent quality of all parts
customer_reviews.text: I am a paraplegic and was in need of a back support pillow and this came with multiple parts which you can use many different ways. I use one part to place under my feet at night. I am also in bed and unable to get up much due to recovering from a pressure sore, so I have to sleep on my stomach and side. I am able to use another part behind my back to keep me from rolling onto my back. these are all large individual sections which I have found very useful and well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Tx RV Travelers

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when my shoulder itis flared to where I could not sleep laying down. It was worth a try but my conclusion is pillows work better since they mold to my body whereas this hard foam did not have the right contours or moldability to provide comfort and I abandoned its use after a couple of nights of experimenting in favor of the pillows. The shape of the big foam section is not ergonomically correct for my spine and the neck pillow as well all too extremely bulgy hard with no conforming to body. Avana very helpful on the return.
customer_reviews.author: gary

customer_reviews.title: The unit is firm but not hard or uncomfortable. There is absolutely no smell upon opening.
customer_reviews.text: After undergoing “The Whipple” surgery for pancreatic cancer nine years ago, it has been extremely difficult for me to lie flat on my back or on my side. I needed something that would prop my upper body up, be durable, comfortable and hold up to everyday use. The Avana provides all of these and more. This is not a flimsy made product. It’s firm and constructed well. I would highly recommend the Avana Support Pillow. One more thing: I love all the different ways each element can be used separately or as a grouping. It has improved my sleeping and I can watch tv or read sitting up during the day.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Baseball

customer_reviews.title: It's like laying on a rock
customer_reviews.text: Laying on this thing hurts. It's way too hard. I tried adjusting pillow positions and using different pillow combinations in an attempt to find a comfortable arrangement. My neck and back hurt from laying on this thing.
customer_reviews.author: James Cole

customer_reviews.title: Used post c-section
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I could sleep in bed after my c-section, but it wasn't the most comfortable. What I thought would be a great perk of multiple pieces, so I could get the perfect fit, was a hassle. I was constantly waking up and needing to move the pieces back into place. They moved around a lot, but I'm not sure how. I just had surgery and was hardly moving while I slept. It was ok, but I honestly preferred the $25 reading pillow I bought for the couch. This is currently sitting in our master closet. I wouldn't buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: RRS

customer_reviews.title: Great for post-surgery comfort
customer_reviews.text: My 65-year old wife just had shoulder replacement surgery and this orthopedic pillow system is perfect. The shipping container is very slick so just unwrap the plastic and let the foam take shape for about 24 hours, then you're ready to go. It helps her sleep comfortably while her shoulder is in a sling. We've reconfigured it multiple times depending on whether she is eating, sleeping or just relaxing. The memory foam is not too hot which is a problem for most foams. For post-surgery situations like this, the pillow system is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Kirkland Bill

customer_reviews.title: Can easily be modified to suit your body
customer_reviews.text: When I first received this and layed it all out on the bed, I thought 'Oh no. It's too much.' But then I realized because it isn't all one piece, I can use the ones I want, switch it around when I need a new position, and/or take it apart and just use one or two. I got this because of forced bed rest after an operation. It was great that I could have sit up positions, half up - half down or just use the knee wedge. Play with it. What I do know, it always gave me an option to be more comfortable. I will continue to use it for reading in bed, watching TV and normal sleeping.
customer_reviews.author: J. Stirling

customer_reviews.title: Probably not worth $175
customer_reviews.text: We use the pieces separately more than we use them together. I bought this for my partner because he has back issues and isn't sleeping well. I had such high hopes, but bought it as a gift and didn't really get his input to see if he would use it before I got it. He uses the bottom piece and lays his regular pillows on it. But I like the large back rest and leg rest when I read or work in bed.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha H.

customer_reviews.title: I finally found a wedge pillow I can sleep on!!
customer_reviews.text: I tried other wedge pillows but because they didn't have the back of knee bolster I would always slide down in an uncomfortable way and have to choose between sleep refluxing and sleeping at all. This pillow system is so fantastic because the knee bolster prevents me from sliding allowing a comfortable night's rest. Also the angle is adjustable so you can adjust to your comfort level and you can even sit up with it to read or watch tv.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution to post rotaor cuff surgery requiring elevated sleeping
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 4-piece pillow set for the purpose of creating optional partial reclining positions post shoulder surgery. I could not be more pleased and would highly recommend! You can adjust these pillows many ways. I've used the long narrow piece as both a pillow and an arm rest, which greatly relieves the strap tension from shoulder brace. You can easily flip/maneuver these with just one hand. Lightweight, super soft yet very supportive. Well worth the money, particularly if you don't have a recliner/chair in your home. I sleep like a baby using these!
customer_reviews.author: Pro

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: The product was made just as outlined. The unit was delivered on time compressed and opened up once the plastic wrap was removed. I have tried to get comfortable with this unit prior to my shoulder surgery, but am not able to. The pillows are made of foam that does not give and you feel like you are lying on a very hard board. I can not recommend this unit for comfort of any type. If you are looking for a solid back support with no give this is your item.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R.

customer_reviews.title: super comfortable for sitting up in bed for reading, etc.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for sitting up in bed to read, watch tv, write. My neck and shoulders had been feeling tension when I sat in bed and these pillows alleviate that very well. it is super comfortable. I waited awhile to spend the money and also to bring more "stuff" into the house, but this really helps a lot and likely is good for my health in terms of present and long term pain.

It is definitely versatile, but it hasn’t differentiated itself from any other bed reading pillow, except by the price.

It's everything I needed and more. It allows for proper alignment, support, adjustable for any position, has high-density memory foam, and is extremely comfortable. The bamboo cover is machine washable, so it's a win-win. I'm overjoyed with this product and look forward to using it whether for work or play.

I can’t recommend this any higher.

product_meta.title: Avana Kind Bed Orthopedic Support Pillow Comfort System with Bamboo Cover
product_meta.description: Size:24-Inch-WideAvana has created the ultimate system of serenity to give you head-to-toe relaxation in the comfort of your own bed. The Kind Bed Comfort System offers four incredible pieces that work together in harmony to bolster your body while sitting up in your bed. The Back Scoop offers firm yet supple lumbar support, which can be adjusted by sliding up and down the Scoop Cradle to fit your body. The Headrest acts as a base for your neck, preventing any unfortunate kinks, and the Knee Rest ensures that you stay lifted in place and in a natural position for relief on your joints. The end result is sublime, flexible comfort to give you the ideal support to read, watch TV, or meditate. All four pieces of the Kind Bed Comfort System are made from ultra comfortable polyurethane foam that gives you the perfect amount of support, while an added layer of memory foam contours and cradles your body. The antimicrobial covers have lush rayon made from bamboo top that feels supremely soft, book-ended by coordinating microsuede on the sides. The covers are both removable and machine-washable to make cleaning a breeze.
